locations.name: Meghalaya Caves
locations.description: Home to the longest caves in India, including Mawsmai and Siju caves.

locations.name: Elephanta Caves
locations.description: UNESCO World Heritage site with rock-cut caves dedicated to Lord Shiva.

locations.name: Ajanta Caves
locations.description: Ancient Buddhist cave temples known for stunning frescoes and carvings.

locations.name: Badami Caves
locations.description: Famous for Hindu and Jain rock-cut temples carved in sandstone.

locations.name: Belum Caves
locations.description: The second longest cave system in India, known for stalactites and stalagmites.

locations.name: Borra Caves
locations.description: Beautiful limestone caves with natural formations, located in the Araku Valley.

locations.name: Krem Liat Prah
locations.description: The longest natural cave in India with unique limestone formations.

locations.name: Edakkal Caves
locations.description: Prehistoric caves with petroglyphs dating back to the Neolithic Age.

locations.name: Krem Mawmluh
locations.description: A unique cave known for its underground river and rock formations.

locations.name: Pandav Caves
locations.description: Mythologically significant caves associated with the Pandavas from Mahabharata.
